author: Anonymous Mouse
title: Style rule
question:
Can i separate my program for each function by using ;; ========== ? It makes me clear.
;; =============================================================================

(@htdf main)
(@signature Ball -> Ball)
;; start the game, call with (main B1)
;; <no tests for main functions>

(@template htdw-main)

(define (main b)
  (big-bang b
    (on-draw   render-ball)   ;Ball -> Image
    (on-tick   next-ball)     ;Ball -> Ball
    (on-mouse  handle-mouse)));Ball Integer Integer MouseEvent -> Ball
            

;; =============================================================================

(@htdf render-ball)
instructor_answer:
No that's not in our style rules.
Imagine a company of 700 employees where everyone marked their functions in a different way?
In our style functions always start with @htdf.
